availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel D. Duty (Sharpsburg, Bath County, Kentucky, merchant.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Sarah L. Duty. Married to Lodema B. Duty. Father of Lallie Duty. Merchant in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 99B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, City/District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 71.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 3, p. 430B.
"D.D. Duty (1825-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 84918709, accessed September 26, 2022,
https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84918709.
